Posts.Content: Recovery from RRP is a long haul. At 5 days out your insides are still in trauma. Keep doing your kegels and walking and you'll see improvement over time. The first couple weeks are pretty tough, but it soon gets better. You have a long way to go so try to be patient. You're cancer-free, hopefully. That's the big thing.
Posts.Signature: ~ Greywolf ~ Clinical: psa 5.7 DRE negative biopsy 3+4 1 of 14 cores positive 6 cores HGPIN Da Vinci RP 9/8/11 negative margins negative lymph & SVs final pathology 3+3 final stage T2c

Posts.Title: Incontenence

Posts.Content: I'm 4 years post-op and have zero male response. I've tried injections and the pump with no real success. Prolonged celibacy is killing me so now I'm considering a penile prosthesis as a last resort. I would like to hear from urologists and men who have gone this route, and from any woman who's partner has had this done. Pros and cons greatly appreciated. Thanks! azgreywolf

Posts.Content: Thank you, Chuck, for the assist. But sadly not one man who has had this procedure has replied. Very disappointing.

Posts.Title: Do Penile Implants work for you?

Posts.Content: PS. What was the cost of the prosthesis procedure? I have BC/BS and they won't tell me if they'll cover it or not, and, if so, what could I expect as my out-of-pocket expense. Thanks for any info on that.

Posts.Title: Trimix & Penile Prosthesis Experience??

Posts.Content: Guys, I am 28 months post-op and altho my surgeon says he left one nerve intact, I have zero natural response. I haven't been satisfied with the vacuum pump (despite 3 tight rings I deflate upon entry) or with Trimix (just not enough size or hardness). I have stepped up the Trimix to .32 and am not certain its safe to go much higher. Any thoughts on that are welcome. I don't want to go on the rest of my life being sexually frustrated, (not to mention my girlfriend's desires), and so I am seriously considering the penile prosthesis as a last resort. I would greatly appreciate any feedback from men knowledgeable in this procedure, and especially those who have undergone it. Is it a viable and reliable solution to this unfortunate situation? Thanks for your feedback guys.
Posts.Signature: ~ Greywolf ~ Clinical: psa 5.7 DRE negative biopsy 3+4 1 of 14 cores positive 6 cores HGPIN Da Vinci RP 9/8/11 negative margins negative lymph & SVs final pathology 3+3 final stage T2c
Posts.Title: Trimix & Penile Prosthesis Experience??

Posts.Content: Jebstart, I was left with one nerve, badly damaged. 150mg of Viagra gave a little size, but still too droopy to even try to use. Trimix only got me a semi, again not adequate for penetration. A vacuum pump with 3 rings got me fully up, but much of the blood pushed back out anyway on insertion and I'd be in but floppy. I've had one orgasm via intercourse in 3.5 years. The implant is my last great hope. If you're only 10 months out and getting a semi, give it some time. I've heard surgeons won't do an implant till 24 months post-op at the earliest.
Posts.Signature: ~ Greywolf ~ Clinical: psa 5.7 DRE negative biopsy 3+4 1 of 14 cores positive 6 cores HGPIN Da Vinci RP 9/8/11 negative margins negative lymph & SVs final pathology 3+3 final stage T2c
Posts.Title: Penile Implant Surgery??

Posts.Content: Men, I am 3.5 years post-RP, PSA undetectable and I feel blessed to be cured. My heart goes out to men recently diagnosed and those still struggling with this awful disease. However all is not perfect for me. I have not had one decent intercourse experience in those 3.5 years. I've tried all the non-invasive options, none worked at all. Enough is enough! I'm now scheduled for the AMS 700 GLX implant next Wed. at Mayo Clinic. I'm nervous, not sure what to expect. I've read a couple discouraging testimonials and seen the video, this procedure is pretty gruesome. But if it works it worth it. If any man has undergone implant surgery I would grealy appreciate if you would share your experience at the hospital, during the recovery period and thereafter. Online or via private message, whichever you prefer. Thanks... azgreywolf

AgeInfo.Phrase: Implant Surgery   Men  I am 3 5 years post RP  PSA
